item.description:
Gene Baur to Speak at the Fairfield Public Library

Meet Farm Sanctuary President and Co-Founder Gene Baur on Saturday, March 26 and hear him speak about his national best-seller, Farm Sanctuary: Changing Hearts and Minds About Animals and Food   , as part of the Fairfield Public Library’s month-long One Town, One Book celebration focusing on the theme of food and animal issues. This event is free and open to the public, but advance registration is required. Gene’s book will also be available for purchase, and he will be on hand to sign copies! Please also see the program below for more Farm Sanctuary-related activities occurring throughout the day. 

What:
Fairfield Public Library’s “Farm Sanctuary Day”:
A One Town, One Book event 

Program:
11 a.m.
Reading by Maya Gottfried, author of Our Farm: By the Animals of Farm Sanctuary   and craft program
11:45 a.m. – 12:45 p.m.
Vegan lunches available for purchase from Health in a Hurry
1 p.m.
Presentation by Gene Baur, author of Farm Sanctuary: Changing Hearts and Minds About Animals and Food

Where:
Fairfield Public Library
1080 Old Post Rd.
Fairfield, CT 06824 

RSVP:

For more details and to register for this event, please visit the Fairfield Public Library website

Other questions can be directed to the branch reference librarian, Mary A. Coe.
Gene looks forward to seeing you there!

group.name: The New Haven Vegan Meetup Group

item.name: Gene Baur to Speak at the Fairfield Public Library
